issue.title: Controlling Pan Tilt Gimbal using JointControlPlugin and JointStatePublisher
Controlling Pan Tilt Gimbal using JointControlPlugin and JointStatePublisher
Controlling Pan Tilt Gimbal using JointControlPlugin and JointStatePublisher

content.raw:
There are a number of `examples` available in the `ignition gazebo` sources: https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/src/default/examples/worlds/.

Take a look at the [joint_controller.sdf](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/src/default/examples/worlds/joint_controller.sdf) for an example that uses the `JointController` plugin.

[lift_drag.sdf](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/src/default/examples/worlds/lift_drag.sdf) uses the `JointStatePublisher` plugin.
content.html:
There are a number of examples available in the ignition gazebo sources: https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/src/default/examples/worlds/.

Take a look at the joint_controller.sdf for an example that uses the JointController plugin.

lift_drag.sdf uses the JointStatePublisher plugin.

issue.title: Controlling Pan Tilt Gimbal using JointControlPlugin and JointStatePublisher

content.raw: I’m trying to help with this…I added a joint controller and joint state publisher to our sdf file.  I then launched our model \(using localModel:=true\).  I went to a terminal to see if the ignition topics existed, and I ran ‘ign topic -l’, but I don’t see any list of topics.  Is there a way to view ignition topics when running subt ign-gazebo?
content.html: I’m trying to help with this…I added a joint controller and joint state publisher to our sdf file. I then launched our model (using localModel:=true). I went to a terminal to see if the ignition topics existed, and I ran ‘ign topic -l’, but I don’t see any list of topics. Is there a way to view ignition topics when running subt ign-gazebo?

issue.title: Controlling Pan Tilt Gimbal using JointControlPlugin and JointStatePublisher

content.raw: `ign topic -l` should list all topics available. Can you include information about your setup, including commands you are running and if you are inside docker containers?
content.html: ign topic -l should list all topics available. Can you include information about your setup, including commands you are running and if you are inside docker containers?

issue.title: Controlling Pan Tilt Gimbal using JointControlPlugin and JointStatePublisher

content.raw: I figured it out.  I had done a ‘sudo apt upgrade’ yesterday and libignition-transport8 got installed which apparently broke compatibility.  If I force it to use 7.4.0, it works as usual.  I’m removing version 8 and hopefully I’ll be good to go.
content.html: I figured it out. I had done a ‘sudo apt upgrade’ yesterday and libignition-transport8 got installed which apparently broke compatibility. If I force it to use 7.4.0, it works as usual. I’m removing version 8 and hopefully I’ll be good to go.

issue.title: Controlling Pan Tilt Gimbal using JointControlPlugin and JointStatePublisher

content.raw:
Ok, we’re now able to make the pan/tilt rotate on each axis using ignition commands.  However, the ros\_ign\_bridge does not appear to support Float64 conversion to ign::msg::Double \(which is what the joint states use\).  I’m looking here:

[https://github.com/osrf/ros\_ign/blob/melodic/ros\_ign\_bridge/README.md](https://github.com/osrf/ros_ign/blob/melodic/ros_ign_bridge/README.md)

I’ve tried the following in our vehicle\_topics.launch file, but the ros topic does not show up:

```xml
<node 
pkg="ros_ign_bridge" 
type="parameter_bridge" 
name="ros_ign_bridge_gimbal_pan" 
args="/model/$(arg name)/joint/pan_gimbal_joint/cmd_vel@std_msgs/Float64]ignition.msgs.Double">
</node>
```

I also tried using a Float32, but no joy.  I’ll look into whether we can modify ros\_ign\_bridge to support Float64 to Double conversion…
content.html:
Ok, we’re now able to make the pan/tilt rotate on each axis using ignition commands. However, the ros_ign_bridge does not appear to support Float64 conversion to ign::msg::Double (which is what the joint states use). I’m looking here:

https://github.com/osrf/ros_ign/blob/melodic/ros_ign_bridge/README.md

I’ve tried the following in our vehicle_topics.launch file, but the ros topic does not show up:

<node 
pkg="ros_ign_bridge" 
type="parameter_bridge" 
name="ros_ign_bridge_gimbal_pan" 
args="/model/$(arg name)/joint/pan_gimbal_joint/cmd_vel@std_msgs/Float64]ignition.msgs.Double">
</node>

I also tried using a Float32, but no joy. I’ll look into whether we can modify ros_ign_bridge to support Float64 to Double conversion…

issue.title: Controlling Pan Tilt Gimbal using JointControlPlugin and JointStatePublisher

content.raw:
We’re also stuck on creating a bridge for the Joint State Publisher. We’re getting the following error when we try to launch. I’m guessing I’m using the wrong ignition type.

\[ERROR\] \[1585071570.190259796\]: Failed to create a bridge for topic \[/world/simple\_tunnel\_02/model/A1/joint\_state\] with ROS type \[sensor\_msgs/JointState\] and Ignition Transport type \[ignition.msgs.Joint\]

The following is our code for the joint state publisher in vehicle\_topics.launch. The /world/simple\_tunnel\_02/model/A1/joint\_state topic publishes fine when we echo it. 

```
    <!-- Joint State Publisher -->
    <node
      pkg="ros_ign_bridge"
      type="parameter_bridge"
      name="ros_ign_bridge_joint_state_publisher"
      args="$(arg joint_state_prefix)/joint_state@sensor_msgs/JointState[ignition.msgs.Joint">
      <!-- <remap from="/model/$(arg name)/joint" to="joint"/> -->
    </node>
```

‌

‌
content.html:
We’re also stuck on creating a bridge for the Joint State Publisher. We’re getting the following error when we try to launch. I’m guessing I’m using the wrong ignition type.

[ERROR] [1585071570.190259796]: Failed to create a bridge for topic [/world/simple_tunnel_02/model/A1/joint_state] with ROS type [sensor_msgs/JointState] and Ignition Transport type [ignition.msgs.Joint]

The following is our code for the joint state publisher in vehicle_topics.launch. The /world/simple_tunnel_02/model/A1/joint_state topic publishes fine when we echo it. 

    <!-- Joint State Publisher -->
    <node
      pkg="ros_ign_bridge"
      type="parameter_bridge"
      name="ros_ign_bridge_joint_state_publisher"
      args="$(arg joint_state_prefix)/joint_state@sensor_msgs/JointState[ignition.msgs.Joint">
      <!-- <remap from="/model/$(arg name)/joint" to="joint"/> -->
    </node>

‌

‌

issue.title: Controlling Pan Tilt Gimbal using JointControlPlugin and JointStatePublisher

content.raw:
I have gotten this to work by modifying ros\_ign\_bridge code and adding conversions between std\_msgs::Float64 and ignition::msgs::Double. I have issued a pull request on the ros\_ign git repo:

[https://github.com/osrf/ros\_ign/pull/64](https://github.com/osrf/ros_ign/pull/64)

We will finish modeling the pan/tilt assuming that this pull request will eventually make its way into subt’s system. Any problems with this? We will try to implement a similar fix for converting between ignition.msgs.Joint and ros sensor\_msgs/JointState.
content.html:
I have gotten this to work by modifying ros_ign_bridge code and adding conversions between std_msgs::Float64 and ignition::msgs::Double. I have issued a pull request on the ros_ign git repo:

https://github.com/osrf/ros_ign/pull/64

We will finish modeling the pan/tilt assuming that this pull request will eventually make its way into subt’s system. Any problems with this? We will try to implement a similar fix for converting between ignition.msgs.Joint and ros sensor_msgs/JointState.

issue.title: Controlling Pan Tilt Gimbal using JointControlPlugin and JointStatePublisher

content.raw: Okay, we were able to get the joint state publisher working once we realized that the ignition message type is ignition.msgs.Model and there is already a conversion tool in place in ros\_ign\_bridge.  The pan/tilt is now working as hoped \(we can control using ros topics and we can read the current position using JointState topic\).
content.html: Okay, we were able to get the joint state publisher working once we realized that the ignition message type is ignition.msgs.Model and there is already a conversion tool in place in ros_ign_bridge. The pan/tilt is now working as hoped (we can control using ros topics and we can read the current position using JointState topic).
